name: Introduction to Data Analytics
desc:
Data is the driving force behind almost all aspects of our lives. The huge amount of data generated by enterprises or even individual, will only add value if you are able to comprehend the story behind the data. Data analytics is useful to gain hidden insights from the data we collect. It enables stakeholders to analyse and visualise data in sophisticated ways to make evidence-based decisions.

Whether you want to explore the area of data analytics for work, or pursue a career in data analytics, this course provides the perfect introduction. This course presents foundational knowledge of data analytics and how it can be applied to practical problems. This course provides a short introduction to the fundamentals of data analytics, like gathering data, identifying data sources, cleaning, analysing and visualising data to add value to your decision making.

So, why wait? Add this high-demand skill to your portfolio now and get started! There are no prerequisites for this Microskill course.

Key topics include:

What is data analytics and why is it important for organisations?
Types of data analytics
Preparing and modelling data
Data visualisation
Data analysis and management
Careers in data analytics
title: Data analysis and management

name: Introduction to Cyber Security
desc:
Everyone is more prone to cyber-attacks in today’s interconnected world. Cyber security is the responsibility of everyone. Whether you’re interested in the new area of cyber security as a professional, or just interested in understanding cyber safety, this introduction to cyber security course gives you an overview. It explores cyber security threats along with the broader topic of cyber security in a way that will resonate with you. For instance, you’ll learn what are vulnerabilities and risks, how to stay cyber safe, what are the common cyber threats, and career opportunities in cyber security. In this introductory course, you will also understand the adversaries and motivations of cyber attackers. There are no prerequisites for this Microskill course.

Key topics include:

What is cyber security?
Careers in cyber security
Common cyber security threats
Vulnerabilities and risks
Adversaries and their motivations
Staying cyber safe
Duration: 3 hours
Delivery: Online (self-paced)
Access period: 4 months access from the day of enrolment
title: Common cyber security threats and vulnerabilities

name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
desc:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) has been gaining a lot of attention in the modern world, and this Microskill provides students from all backgrounds with a perfect opportunity to start developing their AI literacy. This Microskill is a gentle and non-technical introduction on how machines learn from data and explore various use cases and applications of AI. You do not require any prior programming or computer science experience for this Microskill.

In this Microskill you will learn about:

Real world applications of AI and how AI is transforming the world around us
Common AI terminologies
Advice from industry experts to start your career in AI
The differentiation between facts and myths in AI
So, why wait?  Add this high-demand skill to your portfolio now and get started!

Key topics include:

About Artificial Intelligence
AI: Towards Machine Learning
AI: Anomaly Detection and Computer Vision
AI: Natural Language Processing and Knowledge mining
AI: Today and Tomorrow
Duration: 2.5 hours
Delivery: Online (self-paced)
Access period: 4 months access from the day of enrolment
title: AI Today and Tomorrow
